intro: Scurrula elastica, commonly known as the rubber plant, is a species of flowering plant in the family Acanthaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa, particularly the Democratic Republic of the Congo. The plant is characterized by its thick, waxy leaves that are often variegated with white or yellow markings. It produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. Scurrula elastica is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and ease of care.
